Data Structures

struct  Persist
struct  tm

Detailed Description

DateTime is used to represent a point of time, consisting of date and time values related to a specific TimeZone.

anonymous enum

static const TimeZone& DateTime::GetTemporaryLocalTimeZone (   )  [inline, static]
 

Returns temporary timezone where every created DateTime object with Alignment LocalTime is shifted to, when this timezone is valid. This timezone is transient.

static void DateTime::SetLocalTimeZone (  const TimeZone &  tz  )  [inline, static]
 

Sets LocalTimeZone. This timezone is persistent. Invoking this method does not affect date and time of further created DateTime objects with Alignment LocalTime

void DateTime::SetMillisecond (  INT  millisecond  )  [inline]

void DateTime::SetSecond (  INT  second  )  [inline]
 

static void DateTime::SetTemporaryLocalTimeZone (  const TimeZone &  tz  )  [inline, static]
 

Sets temporary timezone. When this timezone is set, every created DateTime object with Alignment LocalTime will be shifted to this timezone. This timezone is transient.
